metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16647 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
drivers/net/usb/asix_devices.c in the Linux kernel through 4.13.11 allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and system crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted USB device. Andrey Konovalov discovered that the ASIX Ethernet USB driver in the Linux kernel did not properly handle suspend and resume events. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16647` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-1014-azure - 4.13.0-1014.17
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1014-azure - 4.13.0-1014.17
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1012-gcp - 4.13.0-1012.16
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1012-gcp - 4.13.0-1012.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-38-generic - 4.13.0-38.43~16.04.1
linux-image-4.13.0-38-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-38.43~16.04.1
linux-image-4.13.0-38-lowlatency - 4.13.0-38.43~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-38-generic - 4.13.0-38.43~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1022-oem - 4.13.0-1022.24
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1014-azure - 4.13.0-1014.17
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1014-azure - 4.13.0-1014.17
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1012-gcp - 4.13.0-1012.16
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1012-gcp - 4.13.0-1012.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-38-generic - 4.13.0-38.43~16.04.1

linux-image-4.13.0-38-lowlatency - 4.13.0-38.43~16.04.1

criterions.comment: linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1014.17').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').

linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-38.43~16.04.1').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-oem package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1022.24').
